intro: Brachystegia boehmii var. katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to central Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its thick, bark-like trunk and compound leaves. The plant is adapted to seasonal climates, shedding its leaves during the dry season. It produces small, yellow flowers followed by legume-like pods containing seeds. This species is often found in dry, savannah-like habitats and plays a role in local ecosystems.
